content: blocking notions tapestry needle stitch markers scissors scrap yarn & crochet hook approx 4 5mm for tubular cast-on additional notes be sure to read through the instructions carefully before you begin the colorwork charts are located on page 8 & written instructions for charts are located on page 9 instructions for special techniques are also included in-pattern abbreviations are located on page 7 total yardage has been calculated to accommodate a generous swatch of at least 4 x 4 10cm x 10cm in colorwork want to avoid the jog at the beginning of the round check out my jogless jog for colorwork video https //youtu be/7m5sw5daxdo measure your bust at its fullest circumference to pick your ideal size blonde model has a 40 101 5 cm bust and is wearing size 2 numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern when only one number is given in black it applies to all sizes all stitches are knit unless otherwise stated © copyright dear ingénue | all rights raglan depth 11 12 13 14 15 c bust & hip circumference 35 42 48 55 62 d bicep circumference 11 12 14 16 18 e arm length 18 5 18 5 18 5 18 5 18 5 f underarm to hem 15 15 25 15 25 15 75 16 25 in centimeters sizes 1 xs-s 2 m-l 3 xl-2xl 4 3xl-4xl 5 5xl sized to fit bust circumference 73 5-84 94-104 114 5-124 5 134 5-145 152-158 a neck circ 48 5 48 5 53 5 58 5 63 5 b raglan depth 28 30 5 33 35 5 38 c bust & hip circumference 89 106 5 122 139 5 157 5 d bicep circumference 28 30 5 35 5 40 5 45 5 e arm length 47 47 47 47 47 f underarm to hem 38 5 39 39 40 41 5 © copyright dear ingénue | all rights reserved | 2022 | v 1 1 3 phd candidate instructions tubular cast-on in the round collar with smaller needles mc and tubular cast-on this cast-on creates a stretchy edge on ribbing that looks co 92 96 104 116 126 sts like one side flows seamlessly over to the other it is done using scrap yarn and a series of alternating rnds to see right for description of this technique achieve this cast on can also be done flat in less steps but this method allows you to begin in the round place marker and join to work in the round careful not to twist using scrap yarn in a contrasting color and your preferred provisional cast-on method cast on half the number of sts you need chain a few sts cut yarn
